name: extrusion, co-extrusion of plastic sheets | extrusion, co-extrusion | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13653/documentation

This service activity consists in transforming plastic pellets into plastic sheets of 200 microns to 2 mm thickness for the food industry. The amount of processed plastic is NOT included. The inventory refers to an INPUT of 1 kg of plastic pellets, i.e. all inputs and outputs are per kg of raw materials (excluding internal recycling), ie. T where;t (final product)= 0.969 kg / kg of raw material input;Y ( losses being recycled within the process (=internal recycling), closed loop)= 0.156  kg / kg of raw material input;t' (losses recycled in external, opened loop)=  0.031  kg / kg of raw material input;T (raw materials, exluding internal recycling)= 1  kg / kg of aw material input.;That is, an input of 1 kg of plastic pellets yields 0.969 kg of extruded plastic sheets. Losses caused during production that are recycled internally are not accounted for explicitly. However, the additional energy requirements associated with the internally recycled plastic are considered.; In detail, the activity includes: ;-	water and energy consumption;-	required auxiliaries such like detergents and solvents;-	production infrastructure ;-	direct emissions to air (VOC);-	wastewater treatment of the used auxiliaries;-	end of life of the production wastes incinerated and recycled externally;.;Prepared and submitted by Quantis, financed, supported and followed by Eco-Emballages (Sophie Bonnier, sophie.bonnier@ecoemballages.fr) and Elipso (Vincent Colard, v.colard@elipso.org)

The activity starts with the arrival of the raw materials, i.e. plastic pellets.

The activity ends with the production of co-extruded plastic sheets. This process contains the auxiliaries and energy demand for the mentioned conversion process of plastics. The processed amount of plastics is NOT included into the dataset. The packaging of raw materials and final product is not considered.
category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: information from different French converting companies
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From the production volume of the three sampled to the production volume of all extrusion and co extrusion of plastic sheets production facilities in France.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Survey. Around 60 000 tons of thermoformed products are sold in France per year (excluding FFS process that is not considered here). The survey represents the production volume weighted average of three companies in France covering roughly 50% of the overall market volume of this technology.

exchanges.description:
Service activity transforming plastic pellets into plastic sheets of 200 microns to 2 mm thickness for the food industry.
This activity should be used as follows: If an activity requires 1 kg of plastic sheets (produced by an inline plastic sheets and thermoforming process) the user should list (i) 1/0.969 = 1.032 kg of the service and 1.032 kg of the plastic type processed.
